verses.verse: (For the choir director; for flute accompaniment. A Psalm of David.) Give <S%H238><s%> ear <S%H238><s%> to my words, <S%H561><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Consider <S%H995><s%> my groaning. <S%H1901><s%>
Heed <S%H7181><s%> the sound <S%H6963><s%> of my cry <S%H7768><s%> for help, <S%H7773><s%> my King <S%H4428><s%> and my God, <S%H430><s%> For to Thee do I pray. <S%H6419><s%>

In the morning, <S%H1242><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou wilt hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice; <S%H6963><s%> In the morning <S%H1242><s%> I will order <S%H6186><s%> [my prayer] to Thee and [eagerly] watch. <S%H6822><s%>
For Thou art not a God <S%H410><s%> who takes <S%H2655><s%> pleasure <S%H2655><s%> in wickedness; <S%H7562><s%> No <S%H3808><s%> evil <S%H9563><s%> dwells <S%H1481><s%> with Thee.
The boastful <S%H1984><s%> shall not stand <S%H3320><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> Thine eyes; <S%H5869><s%> Thou dost hate <S%H8130><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> who do <S%H6466><s%> iniquity. <S%H205><s%>
Thou dost destroy those who speak <S%H6><s%> falsehood; <S%H1696><s%> The Lord <S%H3577><s%> abhors <S%H3068><s%> the man <S%H8581><s%> of bloodshed <S%H376><s%> and deceit. <S%H1818><s%>

But as for me, by Thine abundant <S%H7230><s%> lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> I will enter <S%H935><s%> Thy house, <S%H1004><s%> At Thy holy <S%H6944><s%> temple <S%H1964><s%> I will bow <S%H7812><s%> in reverence <S%H3374><s%> for Thee.

O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> lead <S%H5148><s%> me in Thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> because <S%H4616><s%> of my foes; <S%H9596><s%> Make <S%H3474><s%> Thy way <S%H1870><s%> straight <S%H3474><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me.

There <S%H369><s%> is nothing <S%H369><s%> reliable <S%H3559><s%> in what <S%H6310><s%> they say; <S%H6310><s%> Their inward <S%H7130><s%> part <S%H7130><s%> is destruction <S%H1942><s%> [itself]; Their throat <S%H1627><s%> is an open <S%H6605><s%> grave; <S%H6913><s%> They flatter <S%H9140><s%> with their tongue. <S%H3956><s%>

Hold <S%H816><s%> them guilty, <S%H816><s%> O God; <S%H430><s%> By their own devices <S%H4156><s%> let them fall! <S%H5307><s%> In the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of their transgressions <S%H6588><s%> thrust <S%H5080><s%> them out, For they are rebellious <S%H4784><s%> against Thee.

But let all <S%H3605><s%> who take <S%H2620><s%> refuge <S%H2620><s%> in Thee be glad, <S%H8055><s%> Let them ever <S%H5769><s%> sing <S%H7442><s%> for joy; <S%H7442><s%> And mayest Thou shelter <S%H5526><s%> them, That those who love <S%H157><s%> Thy name <S%H8034><s%> may exult <S%H5970><s%> in Thee.

For it is Thou who dost bless <S%H1288><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> man, <S%H6662><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou dost surround <S%H9401><s%> him with favor <S%H7522><s%> as with a shield. <S%H6793><s%>
